# Please cite arXiv:2309.03262
# The Delta chi^2 with which cos(delta) can be determined for various true values of cos(delta) and with various levels of information on the nu_e row given 6.5+6.5 years of DUNE data
# The three different nu_e row information cases are:
#   current: global fit for the five parameters other than delta. Basically Daya Bay, RENO, Double Chooz, KamLAND, and solar (SNO, SK, Borexino, pp, ...)
#   JUNO: expected precision after 6 years of JUNO, or the global fit, whichever is better (JUNO improves theta12 and both Delta m^2's)
#   perfect: if all five other oscillation parameters are known perfectly
# This data file:
#   First row: the n various values of cos(delta) considered
#   The columns in the remaining rows:
#     The value of cos(delta) to test
#     The value of the Delta chi^2 for each of the n values of cos(delta) with current priors
#     The value of the Delta chi^2 for each of the n values of cos(delta) with JUNO priors
#     The value of the Delta chi^2 for each of the n values of cos(delta) with perfect priors
